intro: Palicourea flagellata, commonly known as the whip plant, is a climbing shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds.
